children.subject: Worst case you can always find some in person breadth class to take (in person decals wouldn't work though afaik, unfortunately)

I started school in fall 2020 so while technically I'm a continuing student, I'm new in that this is my first sem in the US (so my I20 start date is this sem), and it seemed like all students with fall 21 as I20 start dates were consodered new, although I forgot the source. Do u know anything abt this?
Actually it says right there towards the lower part of your screenshot. I"m really hoping in person discussions count.
Yeah you're probably right - it's up to the I20. Let's hope advising people agree discussion counts.

Correct me if I am wrong, but I think fully remote is fine assuming you're continuing students. New students has to take at least 1 in-person tho.

source: 

- https://internationaloffice.berkeley.edu/students/current/full-time_reqs

- https://internationaloffice.berkeley.edu/covid-19-updates-faq#newstudentsfall2021

- https://www.ice.gov/doclib/coronavirus/covid19faq.pdf

history.content:
I'm an international currently in the US (and I was originally planning to stay here for the fall semester), but I only just found out that the requirement of having to take at least 1 in-person instruction still applies this semester as well. 

Unfortunately, all my courses right now are lowerdiv CS/DS, which are all remote, and I'm actually quite worried that I might have to go back (after having paid all the fees for housing etc, although I guess it's kinda my fault). Does any one of you know if in-person discussions count as an in-person instruction at all, or if there are other ways to bypass or satisfy this requirement for int'l students? 

*I did send an email to BIO just now, but I'm just super worried and would like to know if there's anything I can do asap.
history.subject: internationals—do you know if in-person discussions count as an in-person instruction?
